Sequence Information.Peptide Name: XPF-SP2  (XPF-SE2; natural AMPs; frogs, amphibians, animals; UCLL1a
Sequence Information.Source: skin secrections,Silurana paratropicalis, also Cameroon clawed frog,Silurana epitropicalisSE2, Cameroon, Africa

Literature Information.Literature: 88% SIMILAR TOCPF-ST4.Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 100 uM),  A. baumannii (MIC 25 uM). Also E. coli (MIC>160 uM), S. aureus (MIC 80 uM).Toxicity: poor hemo.lytic hRBC (HC50 >160 uM).Found in multiple species. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Mechkarska M, Eman A, Coquet L, Jérôme L, Jouenne T, Vaudry H, King JD, Takada K, Conlon JM. 2011
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol Part D Genomics Proteomics. 2011 Jun;6(2):206-12.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Genome duplications within the Xenopodinae do not increase the multiplicity of antimicrobial peptides in Silurana paratropicalis and Xenopus andrei skin secretions
